text: Ontario delivers long-awaited gas-tax revenue to cash-strapped cities (Canadian Press) Canadian Press - MISSISSAUGA, Ont. (CP) - The Ontario government finally made good Friday on its long-awaited promise to start siphoning millions in gas-tax revenue to municipalities desperate to fix crumbling infrastructure and underfunded transit systems.

The money will be distributed based on a formula that takes into account population and transit ridership. "This is a historic day for Ontario," McGuinty said at a news conference in Mississauga. "We are delivering on our promise to share the gas tax with municipalities so they can build the transit systems and infrastructure that our communities need." The announcement was welcomed by municipal leaders, who have long argued that they need a stable source of funding to address growing infrastructure needs. The funding will be used to support a range of projects, including the expansion of public transit systems, road repairs, and the construction of new infrastructure. text: U.S. Limits Chinese Sock Imports U.S. imports of socks from China will be strictly limited next year, the Bush administration announced yesterday -- a decision that could herald similar action against other types of Chinese-made clothing that have the potential to dominate world markets.
